title: Coronavirus and Omicron: 10 winter superfoods that can help boost immune system | The Times of India
description: Here are a few winter superfoods that can help you stay healthy. Add them to your daily diet and stay safe.
cleaned_text: Winter season is in its full swing and at the same time, the new variant of Coronavirus (Omicron) has brought back the fear too. In this situation, it is very important to take care of health and also take care of the immune system. Here are a few winter superfoods that can help you stay safe and healthy. Add them to your daily diet and stay safe. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 02/11Ghee As per Ayurveda, ghee is one of the most easily digestible fats that is capable of generating instant heat and energy to keep you warm. It also boosts the immune system and prevents skin from getting dry and flaky. You can use it in rice, dal, or roti to get the best flavour. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 03/11Sweet Potato It is rich in vitamin A, potassium and other nutrients, that cures constipation, builds immunity, and also reduces inflammation. As per experts, one piece of sweet potato is enough to get a day's beta-carotene. You can have it with milk or simply roast to get a good dose of vitamin C and build your immunity. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 04/11Amla It is a seasonal product that is packed with immunity-boosting vitamin C and keeps disease and illnesses away. You can consume it in the form of murabba, pickle, juice, chutney, or even powder to get the best nutrients. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 05/11Dates From cakes to shakes, dates are used in many ways and are rich in vitamins, minerals, and fibres. Rich in calcium, dates help to keep bone and teeth strong. According to experts, regular consumption of dates can prevent bone-related issues like osteoporosis and arthritis. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 06/11Jaggery As a rich source of iron, jaggery aids in binding oxygen to RBCs. According to the ministry of AYUSH, regular consumption of jaggery in the form of kadha is good for boosting the immune system, and also helps in fighting illnesses like flu and common cold as a higher body temperature is less conducive for microbial growth. Jaggery is also loaded with many minerals like iron, magnesium, zinc, selenium, and potassium, which boost the immune system and help in keeping infections at bay. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 07/11Millets They are rich in fibre, have low-glycemic index, and are packed with a range of nutrients, vitamins, and minerals. According to experts, including them in winter diet makes the body healthier. For instance, adding ragi to your daily diet helps in losing weight as the amino acid present in it tends to reduce the appetite. Loaded with dietary fibre, ragi helps in improving digestion. It is known to help with conditions of insomnia, anxiety, and depression too. Also, bajra, rich in fibre and vitamin B promotes muscle gain and helps you keep warm in winters. Another millet that is good is bajra, which is rich in fiber and increases blood circulation, thereby generating body health. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 08/11Broccoli Broccoli is a powerhouse of nutrients that help boost the immune system. As per experts, one cup of broccoli provides as much vitamin C as an orange. Broccoli is rich in beta-carotene, potassium, magnesium, zinc, and iron. The best way to consume broccoli is to par boil or sauté. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 09/11Ginger It has oxidative and anti-inflammatory properties which help cure the sore throat in winters. Ginger is also effective in boosting the immune system and has also proved to reduce the risk of cardiovascular diseases, cancer, digestive issues and nausea. As per experts, the antimicrobial property of ginger helps the body fight against germs, viruses and bacteria. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 10/11Walnuts Rich in antioxidants and omega-3 are great for your health. Also, walnuts have anti-inflammatory properties that help boost the immune system. (Image: istock) [readmore](javascript://) 11/11Peanuts Peanuts are full of antioxidants, vitamins and minerals that help reduce the risk of cardiovascular diseases, cholesterol issues and also cancer. It also boosts the immune system.
